            COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The project rating is highly
            satisfactory, sustainability is likely, and the
            institutional development impact is substantial. The main
            lessons address: 1) the adequacy of beneficiaries
            representation, whose participation was monitored through
            project committees on the basis of inclusion, with
            representatives from all social groups, including
            women's groups, youth, and poor families; 2) social
            interventions, suggesting that an independent implementing
            agency should manage the program, with strong leadership.
            This would enhance transparency, and accountability to build
            trust among beneficiaries, and communities, and, would in
            turn be beneficial for promotional campaigns, crucial for
            successful community based projects; 3) the critical aspects
            of capacity building, and output indicators, which are time
            consuming and difficult to measure, but, its absence caused
            unnecessary implementation delays. However, workshops, and
            training sessions based on participatory approaches proved
            successful, and were highly regarded by beneficiaries; and,
            4) ownership, and sustainability, which were enhanced
            following the first detailed review of subprojects, when the
            Bank placed responsibility on the implementing agency, who
            met the challenge, and further suggested innovations on
            appraisal, and monitoring, responsible as well for social,
            and environmental criteria in project selection.
